title: The Unbearable Lightness of Scones
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Johnnie and I used to go all over the Sma' Glen.

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Scones
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Johnnie and I used to go all over the Sma' Glen.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: 'There was a great tribe o' them cam' up the Sma' Glen the day, an' we hinna a man in the house.'

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: 'Tell Maister Fergus about Rory Maclean bein 1 shot in the Sma' Glen, Ewan,' said young Rob Stewart, whose father had been in Turrich.

title: Spare hours...
author: Brown, John
snippet: We have seen many of our most remarkable glens and mountain gorges, — Glencroe and Glencoe, — Glen Nevis, — the noblest of them all, — the Sma' Glen, Wordsworth's Glen Almain (Glen almond), where Ossian sleeps, the lower part of Glen Lyon, and many others of all kinds of sublimity and beauty; but we know nothing more noticeable, more unlike any other place, more impressive, than this short, deep, narrow, and sudden glen.

title: Spare hours.
author: Brown, John
snippet: We have seen many of our most remarkable glens and mountain gorges, — Glencroe and Glencoe, — Glen Nevis, — the noblest of them all, — the Sma' Glen, Wordsworth's Glen Almain (Glenalmond), where Ossian sleeps, the lower part of Glen Lyon, and many others of all kinds of snbHmity and beauty; but we know nothing more noticeable, more unlike any other place, more impressive, than this short, deep, narrow, and sudden glen.

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: hill, over the end of which it rose, and then passeddown on the other side into the deep ravine of theSma' Glen.

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: Sae on we went into the Sma' Glen, verraquiet and carefu' like, for we didna' want words wi'onybody, me wi' a whip, and Duncan wi' naethingbut a bit stick.

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: Sae Duncan agrees, and doon we ranstraight for the head o' the Sma' Glen, and we were justcoming to the water o' Almond when I saw somethinglike a big white stane lying at the side o' the road,and there was a kind o' a dark mark spreading oot fra'it.

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: And sae on we went,up over the moor, and winding roond amang theheather, where the road gangs, zigzag like, doon intothe Sma' Glen.

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: There's cottages here and there a' the way tothe Sma' Glen, and the men were aye runnin' aff totak' whatever was to be had.
